title: Eilenberg–Zilber theorem
summary: In mathematics, specifically in algebraic topology, the Eilenberg–Zilber theorem is an important result in establishing the link between the homology groups of a product space X × Y {\displaystyle X\times Y} and those of the spaces X {\displaystyle X} and Y {\displaystyle Y} . The theorem first appeared in a 1953 paper in the American Journal of Mathematics by Samuel Eilenberg and Joseph A. Zilber.  One possible route to a proof is the acyclic model theorem.
